CommandData: If you want to remotely connect to your deCONZ install via SSH or VNC [here](https://phoscon.de/en/raspbee/sdcard#login-via-ssh)
In the <#704252638727897188> channel you find some suggestions to fix connection issues
If you want to request support for a new device, check the <#708404761140920370> channel for instructions!
If you want a new command added to the bot, please submit a PR [here](https://github.com/Mimiix/deCONZbot/blob/master/commands.json)
You can find a list of official supported devices on [here](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/wiki/Supported-Devices)
A list of error codes can be found [here](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/wiki/Zigbee-Error-Codes-in-the-Log)

To enable debug on a linux installation, use the following commands:```
      sudo systemctl stop deconz-gui
      /usr/bin/deCONZ --dbg-info=2 --dbg-error=2 > debug```

To enable debug for the deCONZ addon in Home-Assistant, add the following to your configuration.yaml:```
    logger:
      default: info
      logs:
        pydeconz: debug
        homeassistant.components.deconz: debug```
The documentation on the REST API can be found [here](https://dresden-elektronik.github.io/deconz-rest-doc/getting_started/)

If you see devices within deCONZ but not in Phoscon, that is most of the time perfectly normal. Phoscon is closed source and needs devices to be added manually by their Developer. However, the device will still be usable with the API/Home-Assistant/OpenHAB etc. You may want to go ahead and request support for your device at the [Phoscon repo](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/phoscon-app-beta/issues)
You can open a bug report in Github [here](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/issues/new?assignees=&labels=Bug+report&template=bug_report.md&title=)

You can find out how to re-do binding and attribute reporting [here](https://discordapp.com/channels/494922323518947329/704252638727897188/709120485862146161) _Please note that Xiaomi sensors don't support this feature_

The firmware update button doesn't work properly in the HA addon or docker installations. Nor does it work fine in Virtual machines. On [this](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/wiki/Update-deCONZ-manually) page you can find out how to update. Please use a native installation to update.
